Which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, Lord, the taunt against Your servants;
How I carry in my heart the taunts of all the many peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With which Your enemies have taunted, Lord,
With which they have taunted the footsteps of Your anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord forever!
Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, You have been our dwelling place in all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the mountains were born
Or You gave birth to the earth and the world,
Even from everlasting to everlasting, You are God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You turn mortals back into dust
And say, “Return, you sons of mankind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a thousand years in Your sight
Are like yesterday when it passes by,
Or like a watch in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have swept them away like a flood, they fall asleep;
In the morning they are like grass that sprouts anew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the morning it flourishes and sprouts anew;
Toward evening it wilts and withers away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For we have been consumed by Your anger,
And we have been terrified by Your wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have placed our guilty deeds before You,
Our hidden sins in the light of Your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all our days have dwindled away in Your fury;
We have finished our years like a sigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for the days of our life, they contain seventy years,
Or if due to strength, eighty years,
Yet their pride is only trouble and tragedy;
For it quickly passes, and we disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who understands the power of Your anger
And Your fury, according to the fear that is due You?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So teach us to number our days,
That we may present to You a heart of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do return, Lord; how long will it be?
And be sorry for Your servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Satisfy us in the morning with Your graciousness,
That we may sing for joy and rejoice all our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make us glad according to the days You have afflicted us,
And the years we have seen evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Your work appear to Your servants
And Your majesty to their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
One who dwells in the shelter of the Most High
Will lodge in the shadow of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will say to the Lord, “My refuge and my fortress,
My God, in whom I trust!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is He who rescues you from the net of the trapper
And from the deadly plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You will not be afraid of the terror by night,
Or of the arrow that flies by day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the plague that stalks in darkness,
Or of the destruction that devastates at noon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A thousand may fall at your side
And ten thousand at your right hand,
But it shall not approach you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will only look on with your eyes
And see the retaliation against the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have made the Lord, my refuge,
The Most High, your dwelling place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No evil will happen to you,
Nor will any plague come near your tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He will give His angels orders concerning you,
To protect you in all your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On their hands they will lift you up,
So that you do not strike your foot against a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will walk upon the lion and cobra,
You will trample the young lion and the serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because he has loved Me, I will save him;
I will set him securely on high, because he has known My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will satisfy him with a long life,
And show him My salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good to give thanks to the Lord
And to sing praises to Your name, Most High;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To declare Your goodness in the morning
And Your faithfulness by night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With the ten-stringed lute and with the harp,
With resounding music on the lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You, Lord, have made me joyful by what You have done,
I will sing for joy over the works of Your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How great are Your works, Lord!
Your thoughts are very deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A stupid person has no knowledge,
Nor does a foolish person understand this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked sprouted up like grass
And all who did injustice flourished,
It was only that they might be destroyed forevermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But You, Lord, are on high forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But You have exalted my horn like that of the wild ox;
I have been anointed with fresh oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And my eye has looked at my enemies,
My ears hear of the evildoers who rise up against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous person will flourish like the palm tree,
He will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Planted in the house of the Lord,
They will flourish in the courtyards of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will still yield fruit in advanced age;
They will be full of sap and very green,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To declare that the Lord is just;
He is my rock, and there is no malice in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your throne is established from of old;
You are from eternity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The floods have lifted up, Lord,
The floods have lifted up their voice,
The floods lift up their pounding waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
More than the sounds of many waters,
Than the mighty breakers of the sea,
The Lord on high is mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, God of vengeance,
God of vengeance, shine forth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, Judge of the earth,
Pay back retribution to the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, Lord, shall the wicked—
How long shall the wicked triumph?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They pour out words, they speak arrogantly;
All who do injustice boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They crush Your people, Lord,
And afflict Your inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They kill the widow and the stranger
And murder the orphans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have said, “The Lord does not see,
Nor does the God of Jacob perceive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention, you stupid ones among the people;
And when will you understand, foolish ones?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who planted the ear, does He not hear?
Or He who formed the eye, does He not see?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who disciplines the nations, will He not rebuke,
He who teaches mankind knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord knows human thoughts,
That they are mere breath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man whom You discipline, Lord,
And whom You teach from Your Law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that You may grant him relief from the days of adversity,
Until a pit is dug for the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will not abandon His people,
Nor will He abandon His inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For judgment will again be righteous,
And all the upright in heart will follow it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who will stand up for me against evildoers?
Who will take his stand for me against those who do injustice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the Lord had not been my help,
My soul would soon have dwelt in the land of silence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I should say, “My foot has slipped,”
Your faithfulness, Lord, will support me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my anxious thoughts multiply within me,
Your comfort delights my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a throne of destruction be allied with You,
One which devises mischief by decree?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They band themselves together against the life of the righteous
And condemn the innocent to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord has been my refuge,
And my God the rock of my refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let’s sing for joy to the Lord,
Let’s shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let’s come before His presence with a song of thanksgiving,
Let’s shout joyfully to Him in songs with instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is a great God
And a great King above all gods,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In whose hand are the depths of the earth,
The peaks of the mountains are also His.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea is His, for it was He who made it,
And His hands formed the dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let’s worship and bow down,
Let’s kneel before the Lord our Maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He is our God,
And we are the people of His pasture and the sheep of His hand.
Today, if you will hear His voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not harden your hearts as at Meribah,
As on the day of Massah in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When your fathers put Me to the test,
They tested Me, though they had seen My work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For forty years I was disgusted with that generation,
And said they are a people who err in their heart,
And they do not know My ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I swore in My anger,
They certainly shall not enter My rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord a new song;
Sing to the Lord, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord, bless His name;
Proclaim the good news of His salvation from day to day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell of His glory among the nations,
His wonderful deeds among all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised;
He is to be feared above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
But the Lord made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Splendor and majesty are before Him,
Strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord, you families of the peoples,
Ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory of His name;
Bring an offering and come into His courtyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Worship the Lord in holy attire;
Tremble before Him, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May the heavens be joyful, and may the earth rejoice;
May the sea roar, and all it contains;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the field be jubilant, and all that is in it.
Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the Lord, for He is coming,
For He is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world in righteousness,
And the peoples in His faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reigns, may the earth rejoice;
May the many islands be joyful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clouds and thick darkness surround Him;
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire goes before Him
And burns up His enemies all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His lightning lit up the world;
The earth saw it and trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the Lord,
At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens declare His righteousness,
And all the peoples have seen His glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Zion heard this and was joyful,
And the daughters of Judah have rejoiced
Because of Your judgments, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You are the Lord Most High over all the earth;
You are exalted far above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Light is sown like seed for the righteous,
And gladness for the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be joyful in the Lord, you righteous ones,
And praise the mention of His holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing a new song to the Lord,
For He has done wonderful things,
His right hand and His holy arm have gained the victory for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made His salvation known;
He has revealed His righteousness in the sight of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has remembered His graciousness and His faithfulness to the house of Israel;
All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shout joyfully to the Lord, all the earth;
Be cheerful and sing for joy and sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to the Lord with the lyre,
With the lyre and the sound of melody.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With trumpets and the sound of the horn
Shout joyfully before the King, the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the sea roar and all it contains,
The world and those who dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the rivers clap their hands,
May the mountains sing together for joy
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reigns, the peoples tremble!
He sits enthroned above the cherubim, the earth quakes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is great in Zion,
And He is exalted above all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they praise Your great and awesome name;
Holy is He.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Exalt the Lord our God
And worship at His holy hill,
For the Lord our God is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shout joyfully to the Lord, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Serve the Lord with jubilation;
Come before Him with rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Enter His gates with thanksgiving,
And His courtyards with praise.
Give thanks to Him, bless His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing of mercy and justice;
To You, Lord, I will sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will carefully attend to the blameless way.
When will You come to me?
I will walk within my house in the integrity of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
A perverse heart shall leave me;
I will know no evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor, him I will destroy;
I will not endure one who has a haughty look and an arrogant heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me;
One who walks in a blameless way is one who will serve me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who practices deceit shall not dwell within my house;
One who speaks lies shall not maintain his position before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every morning I will destroy all the wicked of the land,
So as to eliminate from the city of the Lord all those who do injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, Lord!
And let my cry for help come to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For my days have ended in smoke,
And my bones have been scorched like a hearth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart has been struck like grass and has withered,
Indeed, I forget to eat my bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the loudness of my groaning
My bones cling to my flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I resemble a pelican of the wilderness;
I have become like an owl of the ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lie awake,
I have become like a solitary bird on a housetop.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My enemies have taunted me all day long;
Those who deride me have used my name as a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have eaten ashes like bread,
And mixed my drink with weeping
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of Your indignation and Your wrath;
For You have lifted me up and thrown me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My days are like a lengthened shadow,
And I wither away like grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But You, Lord, remain forever,
And Your name remains to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely Your servants take pleasure in her stones,
And feel pity for her dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the nations will fear the name of the Lord,
And all the kings of the earth, Your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has built up Zion;
He has appeared in His glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has turned His attention to the prayer of the destitute
And has not despised their prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This will be written for the generation to come,
That a people yet to be created may praise the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He looked down from His holy height;
From heaven the Lord looked upon the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To hear the groaning of the prisoner,
To set free those who were doomed to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that people may tell of the name of the Lord in Zion,
And His praise in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the peoples are gathered together,
And the kingdoms, to serve the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has broken my strength in the way;
He has shortened my days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say, “My God, do not take me away in the middle of my days,
Your years are throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In time of old You founded the earth,
And the heavens are the work of Your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But You are the same,
And Your years will not come to an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of Your servants will continue,
And their descendants will be established before You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, my soul,
And all that is within me, bless His holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, my soul,
And do not forget any of His benefits;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who pardons all your guilt,
Who heals all your diseases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who redeems your life from the pit,
Who crowns you with favor and compassion;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who satisfies your years with good things,
So that your youth is renewed like the eagle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord performs righteous deeds
And judgments for all who are oppressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made known His ways to Moses,
His deeds to the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is compassionate and gracious,
Slow to anger and abounding in mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not always contend with us,
Nor will He keep His anger forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
Nor rewarded us according to our guilty deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For as high as the heavens are above the earth,
So great is His mercy toward those who fear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As far as the east is from the west,
So far has He removed our wrongdoings from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as a father has compassion on his children,
So the Lord has compassion on those who fear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He Himself knows our form;
He is mindful that we are nothing but dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for man, his days are like grass;
Like a flower of the field, so he flourishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wind has passed over it, it is no more,
And its place no longer knows about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the mercy of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting for those who fear Him,
And His justice to the children’s children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To those who keep His covenant
And remember His precepts, so as to do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has established His throne in the heavens,
And His sovereignty rules over all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, you His angels,
Mighty in strength, who perform His word,
Obeying the voice of His word!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, all you His angels,
You who serve Him, doing His will.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Covering Yourself with light as with a cloak,
Stretching out heaven like a tent curtain.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He makes the winds His messengers,
Flaming fire His ministers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He established the earth upon its foundations,
So that it will not totter forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You covered it with the deep sea as with a garment;
The waters were standing above the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They fled from Your rebuke,
At the sound of Your thunder they hurried away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains rose; the valleys sank down
To the place which You established for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You set a boundary so that they will not pass over,
So that they will not return to cover the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sends forth springs in the valleys;
They flow between the mountains;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They give drink to every animal of the field;
The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The birds of the sky dwell beside them;
They lift up their voices from among the branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He waters the mountains from His upper chambers;
The earth is satisfied with the fruit of His works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He causes the grass to grow for the cattle,
And vegetation for the labor of mankind,
So that they may produce food from the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And wine, which makes a human heart cheerful,
So that he makes his face gleam with oil,
And food, which sustains a human heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The trees of the Lord drink their fill,
The cedars of Lebanon which He planted,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where the birds build their nests,
And the stork, whose home is the juniper trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The high mountains are for the wild goats;
The cliffs are a refuge for the rock hyrax.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made the moon for the seasons;
The sun knows the place of its setting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You appoint darkness and it becomes night,
In which all the animals of the forest prowl about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young lions roar for their prey
And seek their food from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the sun rises they withdraw,
And they lie down in their dens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person goes out to his work
And to his labor until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
There is the sea, great and broad,
In which are swarms without number,
Animals both small and great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ships move along there,
And Leviathan, which You have formed to have fun in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They all wait for You
To give them their food in due season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You give to them, they gather it up;
You open Your hand, they are satisfied with good.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You send forth Your Spirit, they are created;
And You renew the face of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the glory of the Lord endure forever;
May the Lord rejoice in His works;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He looks at the earth, and it trembles;
He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;
I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my praise be pleasing to Him;
As for me, I shall rejoice in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May sinners be removed from the earth
And may the wicked be no more.
Bless the Lord, my soul.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, call upon His name;
Make His deeds known among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to Him, sing praises to Him;
Tell of all His wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Boast in His holy name;
May the heart of those who seek the Lord be joyful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek the Lord and His strength;
Seek His face continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember His wonders which He has done,
His marvels and the judgments spoken by His mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You descendants of Abraham, His servant,
You sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the Lord our God;
His judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has remembered His covenant forever,
The word which He commanded to a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The covenant which He made with Abraham,
And His oath to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
To Israel as an everlasting covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
As the portion of your inheritance,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they were only a few people in number,
Very few, and strangers in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they wandered from nation to nation,
From one kingdom to another people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He allowed no one to oppress them,
And He rebuked kings for their sakes, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not touch My anointed ones,
And do not harm My prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He called for a famine upon the land;
He broke the whole staff of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent a man before them,
Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They forced his feet into shackles,
He was put in irons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Until the time that his word came to pass,
The word of the Lord refined him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king sent and released him,
The ruler of peoples, and set him free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made him lord of his house,
And ruler over all his possessions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To imprison his high officials at will,
That he might teach his elders wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel also came into Egypt;
So Jacob lived in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He made His people very fruitful,
And made them stronger than their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their heart to hate His people,
To deal cunningly with His servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent His servant Moses,
And Aaron, whom He had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They performed His wondrous acts among them,
And miracles in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent darkness and made it dark;
And they did not rebel against His words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their waters into blood,
And caused their fish to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land swarmed with frogs
Even in the chambers of their kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spoke, and a swarm of flies
And gnats invaded all their territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave them hail for rain,
And flaming fire in their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also struck their vines and their fig trees,
And smashed the trees of their territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spoke, and locusts came,
And creeping locusts, beyond number,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they ate all the vegetation in their land,
And ate the fruit of their ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also fatally struck all the firstborn in their land,
The first fruits of all their vigor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He brought the Israelites out with silver and gold,
And among His tribes there was not one who stumbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt was glad when they departed,
For the dread of them had fallen upon the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spread out a cloud as a covering,
And fire to illumine by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked, and He brought quail,
And satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He opened the rock and water flowed out;
It ran in the dry places like a river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He remembered His holy word
With His servant Abraham;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He led out His people with joy,
His chosen ones with a joyful shout.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also gave them the lands of the nations,
So that they might take possession of the fruit of the peoples’ labor,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who can speak of the mighty deeds of the Lord,
Or can proclaim all His praise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed are those who maintain justice,
Who practice righteousness at all times!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember me, Lord, in Your favor toward Your people.
Visit me with Your salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that I may see the prosperity of Your chosen ones,
That I may rejoice in the joy of Your nation,
That I may boast with Your inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have sinned like our fathers,
We have gone astray, we have behaved wickedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless He saved them for the sake of His name,
So that He might make His power known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So He rebuked the Red Sea and it dried up,
And He led them through the mighty waters, as through the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So He saved them from the hand of one who hated them,
And redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters covered their adversaries;
Not one of them was left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they believed His words;
They sang His praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They quickly forgot His works;
They did not wait for His plan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But became lustfully greedy in the wilderness,
And put God to the test in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So He gave them their request,
But sent a wasting disease among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they became envious of Moses in the camp,
And of Aaron, the holy one of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
And engulfed the company of Abiram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And a fire blazed up in their company;
The flame consumed the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They made a calf in Horeb,
And worshiped a cast metal image.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they exchanged their glory
For the image of an ox that eats grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They forgot God their Savior,
Who had done great things in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wonders in the land of Ham,
And awesome things by the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore He said that He would destroy them,
If Moses, His chosen one, had not stood in the gap before Him,
To turn away His wrath from destroying them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they rejected the pleasant land;
They did not believe His word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But grumbled in their tents;
They did not listen to the voice of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore He swore to them
That He would have them fall in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And that He would bring down their descendants among the nations,
And scatter them in the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They also followed Baal-peor,
And ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they provoked Him to anger with their deeds,
And a plague broke out among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Phinehas stood up and intervened,
And so the plague was brought to a halt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it was credited to him as righteousness,
To all generations forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They also provoked Him to wrath at the waters of Meribah,
So that it went badly for Moses on their account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they were rebellious against His Spirit,
He spoke rashly with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not destroy the peoples,
As the Lord had commanded them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they got involved with the nations
And learned their practices,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And served their idols,
Which became a snare to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They even sacrificed their sons and their daughters to the demons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And shed innocent blood,
The blood of their sons and their daughters
Whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan;
And the land was defiled with the blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they became unclean in their practices,
And were unfaithful in their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the anger of the Lord was kindled against His people,
And He loathed His inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So He handed them over to the nations,
And those who hated them ruled over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their enemies also oppressed them,
And they were subdued under their power.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless He looked at their distress
When He heard their cry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He remembered His covenant for their sake,
And relented according to the greatness of His mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also made them objects of compassion
In the presence of all their captors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save us, Lord our God,
And gather us from the nations,
To give thanks to Your holy name
And glory in Your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
From everlasting to everlasting.
And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good,
For His mercy is everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The redeemed of the Lord shall say so,
Those whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And gathered from the lands,
From the east and from the west,
From the north and from the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They wandered in the wilderness in a desert region;
They did not find a way to an inhabited city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were hungry and thirsty;
Their souls felt weak within them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble;
He saved them from their distresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also had them walk on a straight way,
To go to an inhabited city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall give thanks to the Lord for His mercy,
And for His wonders to the sons of mankind!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He has satisfied the thirsty soul,
And He has filled the hungry soul with what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There were those who lived in darkness and in the shadow of death,
Prisoners in misery and chains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they had rebelled against the words of God
And rejected the plan of the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore He humbled their heart with labor;
They stumbled and there was no one to help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble;
He saved them from their distresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death
And broke their bands apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall give thanks to the Lord for His mercy,
And for His wonders to the sons of mankind!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He has shattered gates of bronze
And cut off bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools, because of their rebellious way,
And because of their guilty deeds, were afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their souls loathed all kinds of food,
And they came close to the gates of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble;
He saved them from their distresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent His word and healed them,
And saved them from their destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall give thanks to the Lord for His mercy,
And for His wonders to the sons of mankind!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall also offer sacrifices of thanksgiving,
And tell of His works with joyful singing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who go down to the sea in ships,
Who do business on great waters;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have seen the works of the Lord,
And His wonders in the deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He spoke and raised a stormy wind,
Which lifted the waves of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They rose up to the heavens, they went down to the depths;
Their soul melted away in their misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They reeled and staggered like a drunken person,
And were at their wits’ end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble,
And He brought them out of their distresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He caused the storm to be still,
So that the waves of the sea were hushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they were glad because they were quiet,
So He guided them to their desired harbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall give thanks to the Lord for His mercy,
And for His wonders to the sons of mankind!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall also exalt Him in the congregation of the people,
And praise Him at the seat of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turns rivers into a wilderness,
And springs of water into a thirsty ground;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And a fruitful land into a salt waste,
Because of the wickedness of those who dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turns a wilderness into a pool of water,
And a dry land into springs of water;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He has the hungry live there,
So that they may establish an inhabited city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And sow fields and plant vineyards,
And gather a fruitful harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also blesses them and they multiply greatly,
And He does not let their cattle decrease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they become few and lowly
Because of oppression, misery, and sorrow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He pours contempt upon noblemen
And makes them wander in a pathless wasteland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But He sets the needy securely on high, away from affliction,
And makes his families like a flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The upright see it and are glad;
But all injustice shuts its mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is wise? He is to pay attention to these things,
And consider the mercy of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is steadfast, God;
I will sing, I will sing praises also with my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, harp and lyre;
I will awaken the dawn!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to You, Lord, among the peoples,
And I will sing praises to You among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Your mercy is great above the heavens,
And Your truth reaches to the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted above the heavens, God,
And may Your glory be above all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that Your beloved may be rescued,
Save with Your right hand, and answer me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has spoken in His holiness:
“I will triumph, I will divide up Shechem,
And measure out the Valley of Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
Who will lead me to Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, have You Yourself not rejected us?
And will You not go forth with our armies, God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give us help against the enemy,
For deliverance by man is worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through God we will do valiantly,
And it is He who will trample down our enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God of my praise,
Do not be silent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they have opened a wicked and deceitful mouth against me;
They have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have also surrounded me with words of hatred,
And have fought against me without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In return for my love they act as my accusers;
But I am in prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they have repaid me evil for good,
And hatred for my love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Appoint a wicked person over him,
And may an accuser stand at his right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he is judged, may he come out guilty,
And may his prayer become sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his days be few;
May another take his office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his children be fatherless,
And his wife a widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his children wander about and beg;
And may they seek sustenance far from their ruined homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the creditor seize everything that he has,
And may strangers plunder the product of his labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May there be none to extend kindness to him,
Nor any to be gracious to his fatherless children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his descendants be eliminated;
May their name be wiped out in a following generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the guilt of his fathers be remembered before the Lord,
And do not let the sin of his mother be wiped out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they be before the Lord continually,
So that He may eliminate their memory from the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he did not remember to show mercy,
But persecuted the afflicted and needy person,
And the despondent in heart, to put them to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also loved cursing, so it came to him;
And he did not delight in blessing, so it was far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he clothed himself with cursing as with his garment,
And it entered his body like water,
And like oil into his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May it be to him as a garment with which he covers himself,
And as a belt which he constantly wears around himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May this be the reward of my accusers from the Lord,
And of those who speak evil against my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But You, God, the Lord, deal kindly with me for the sake of Your name;
Because Your mercy is good, rescue me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am afflicted and needy,
And my heart is wounded within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am passing like a shadow when it lengthens;
I am shaken off like the locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My knees are weak from fasting,
And my flesh has grown lean, without fatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also have become a disgrace to them;
When they see me, they shake their head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Help me, Lord my God;
Save me according to Your mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And may they know that this is Your hand;
You, Lord, have done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May my accusers be clothed with dishonor,
And may they cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my mouth I will give thanks abundantly to the Lord;
And I will praise Him in the midst of many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He stands at the right hand of the needy,
To save him from those who judge his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says to my Lord:
“Sit at My right hand
Until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will stretch out Your strong scepter from Zion, saying,
“Rule in the midst of Your enemies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has sworn and will not change His mind,
“You are a priest forever
According to the order of Melchizedek.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is at Your right hand;
He will shatter kings in the day of His wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will judge among the nations,
He will fill them with corpses,
He will shatter the chief men over a broad country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will drink from the brook by the wayside;
Therefore He will lift up His head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord!
I will give thanks to the Lord with all my heart,
In the company of the upright and in the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great are the works of the Lord;
They are studied by all who delight in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Splendid and majestic is His work,
And His righteousness endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has caused His wonders to be remembered;
The Lord is gracious and compassionate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has given food to those who fear Him;
He will remember His covenant forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has made known to His people the power of His works,
In giving them the inheritance of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The works of His hands are truth and justice;
All His precepts are trustworthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are upheld forever and ever;
They are performed in truth and uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord!
Blessed is a person who fears the Lord,
Who greatly delights in His commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His descendants will be mighty on the earth;
The generation of the upright will be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth and riches are in his house,
And his righteousness endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Light shines in the darkness for the upright;
He is gracious, compassionate, and righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It goes well for a person who is gracious and lends;
He will maintain his cause in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will never be shaken;
The righteous will be remembered forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not fear bad news;
His heart is steadfast, trusting in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His heart is firm, he will not fear,
But will look with satisfaction on his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord!
Praise Him, you servants of the Lord,
Praise the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the name of the Lord
From this time on and forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the rising of the sun to its setting,
The name of the Lord is to be praised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is high above all nations;
His glory is above the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is like the Lord our God,
Who is enthroned on high,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who looks far down to
The heavens and the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He raises the poor from the dust,
He lifts the needy from the garbage heap,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To seat them with noblemen,
With the noblemen of His people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has the infertile woman live in the house
As a joyful mother of children.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Israel went forth from Egypt,
The house of Jacob from a people of a foreign language,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah became His sanctuary;
Israel, His dominion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea looked and fled;
The Jordan turned back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains skipped like rams,
The hills, like lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What ails you, sea, that you flee?
Jordan, that you turn back?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mountains, that you skip like rams?
Hills, like lambs?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble, earth, before the Lord,
Before the God of Jacob,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who turned the rock into a pool of water,
The flint into a fountain of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Not to us, Lord, not to us,
But to Your name give glory,
Because of Your mercy, because of Your truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should the nations say,
“Where, then, is their God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But our God is in the heavens;
He does whatever He pleases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their idols are silver and gold,
The work of human hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have mouths, but they cannot speak;
They have eyes, but they cannot see;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have ears, but they cannot hear;
They have noses, but they cannot smell;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Those who make them will become like them,
Everyone who trusts in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel, trust in the Lord;
He is their help and their shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
House of Aaron, trust in the Lord;
He is their help and their shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord;
He is their help and their shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He will bless those who fear the Lord,
The small together with the great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord increase you,
You and your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May you be blessed of the Lord,
Maker of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are the heavens of the Lord,
But the earth He has given to the sons of mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The dead do not praise the Lord,
Nor do any who go down into silence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for us, we will bless the Lord
From this time and forever.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I love the Lord, because He hears
My voice and my pleas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because He has inclined His ear to me,
Therefore I will call upon Him as long as I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I called upon the name of the Lord:
“Please, Lord, save my life!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gracious is the Lord, and righteous;
Yes, our God is compassionate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord watches over the simple;
I was brought low, and He saved me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return to your rest, my soul,
For the Lord has dealt generously with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You have rescued my soul from death,
My eyes from tears,
And my feet from stumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I shall walk before the Lord
In the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I believed when I said,
“I am greatly afflicted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said in my alarm,
“All people are liars.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What shall I repay to the Lord
For all His benefits to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lift up the cup of salvation,
And call upon the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pay my vows to the Lord;
May it be in the presence of all His people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Precious in the sight of the Lord
Is the death of His godly ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, I surely am Your slave,
I am Your slave, the son of Your female slave,
You have unfastened my restraints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will offer You a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
And call upon the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pay my vows to the Lord,
May it be in the presence of all His people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the courtyards of the Lord’s house,
In the midst of you, Jerusalem!
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord, all nations;
Sing His praises, all peoples!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For His mercy toward us is great,
And the truth of the Lord is everlasting.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good;
For His mercy is everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Israel say,
“His mercy is everlasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh let the house of Aaron say,
“His mercy is everlasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who fear the Lord say,
“His mercy is everlasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From my distress I called upon the Lord;
The Lord answered me and put me in an open space.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is for me; I will not fear;
What can man do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is for me among those who help me;
Therefore I will look with satisfaction on those who hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
Than to trust in people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
Than to trust in noblemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All nations surrounded me;
In the name of the Lord I will certainly fend them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me;
In the name of the Lord I will certainly fend them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You pushed me violently so that I was falling,
But the Lord helped me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my strength and song,
And He has become my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound of joyful shouting and salvation is in the tents of the righteous;
The right hand of the Lord performs valiantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The right hand of the Lord is exalted;
The right hand of the Lord performs valiantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not die, but live,
And tell of the works of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has disciplined me severely,
But He has not turned me over to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open the gates of righteousness to me;
I will enter through them, I will give thanks to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the gate of the Lord;
The righteous will enter through it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to You, for You have answered me,
And You have become my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A stone which the builders rejected
Has become the chief cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This came about from the Lord;
It is marvelous in our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the day which the Lord has made;
Let’s rejoice and be glad in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Please, O Lord, do save us;
Please, O Lord, do send prosperity!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord;
We have blessed you from the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is God, and He has given us light;
Bind the festival sacrifice to the horns of the altar with cords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my God, and I give thanks to You;
You are my God, I exalt You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good;
For His mercy is everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those whose way is blameless,
Who walk in the Law of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who comply with His testimonies,
And seek Him with all their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They also do no injustice;
They walk in His ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have ordained Your precepts,
That we are to keep them diligently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that my ways may be established
To keep Your statutes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will not be ashamed
When I look at all Your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to You with uprightness of heart,
When I learn Your righteous judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will keep Your statutes;
Do not utterly abandon me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can a young man keep his way pure?
By keeping it according to Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With all my heart I have sought You;
Do not let me wander from Your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have treasured Your word in my heart,
So that I may not sin against You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are You, Lord;
Teach me Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my lips I have told of
All the ordinances of Your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have rejoiced in the way of Your testimonies,
As much as in all riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will meditate on Your precepts
And regard Your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I shall delight in Your statutes;
I will not forget Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deal generously with Your servant,
That I may live and keep Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open my eyes, that I may behold
Wonderful things from Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a stranger on the earth;
Do not hide Your commandments from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is crushed with longing
For Your ordinances at all times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You rebuke the arrogant, the cursed,
Who wander from Your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take disgrace and contempt away from me,
For I comply with Your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even though rulers sit and speak against me,
Your servant meditates on Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your testimonies also are my delight;
They are my advisers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul clings to the dust;
Revive me according to Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have told of my ways, and You have answered me;
Teach me Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me understand the way of Your precepts,
And I will meditate on Your wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul weeps because of grief;
Strengthen me according to Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove the false way from me,
And graciously grant me Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have chosen the faithful way;
I have placed Your judgments before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cling to Your testimonies;
Lord, do not put me to shame!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I shall run the way of Your commandments,
For You will enlarge my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me, the way of Your statutes, Lord,
And I shall comply with it to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give me understanding, so that I may comply with Your Law
And keep it with all my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me walk in the path of Your commandments,
For I delight in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline my heart to Your testimonies,
And not to dishonest gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn my eyes away from looking at what is worthless,
And revive me in Your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Establish Your word to Your servant
As that which produces reverence for You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take away my disgrace which I dread,
For Your judgments are good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I long for Your precepts;
Revive me through Your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May Your favor also come to me, Lord,
Your salvation according to Your word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that I will have an answer for one who taunts me,
For I trust in Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And do not take the word of truth utterly out of my mouth,
For I wait for Your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will keep Your Law continually,
Forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will walk at liberty,
For I seek Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also speak of Your testimonies before kings
And shall not be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will delight in Your commandments,
Which I love.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the word to Your servant,
In which You have made me hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is my comfort in my misery,
That Your word has revived me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant utterly deride me,
Yet I do not turn aside from Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have remembered Your judgments from of old, Lord,
And comfort myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Burning indignation has seized me because of the wicked,
Who abandon Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your statutes are my songs
In the house of my pilgrimage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, I remember Your name in the night,
And keep Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This has become mine,
That I comply with Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my portion;
I have promised to keep Your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I sought Your favor with all my heart;
Be gracious to me according to Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I considered my ways
And turned my feet to Your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hurried and did not delay
To keep Your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The snares of the wicked have surrounded me,
But I have not forgotten Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At midnight I will rise to give thanks to You
Because of Your righteous judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a companion to all those who fear You,
And to those who keep Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth is full of Your goodness, Lord;
Teach me Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have treated Your servant well,
Lord, according to Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me good discernment and knowledge,
For I believe in Your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before I was afflicted I went astray,
But now I keep Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are good and You do good;
Teach me Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant have forged a lie against me;
With all my heart I will comply with Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart is insensitive, like fat,
But I delight in Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good for me that I was afflicted,
So that I may learn Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Law of Your mouth is better to me
Than thousands of gold and silver pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your hands made me and fashioned me;
Give me understanding, so that I may learn Your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who fear You see me and be glad,
Because I wait for Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know, Lord, that Your judgments are righteous,
And that You have afflicted me in faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May Your favor comfort me,
According to Your word to Your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May Your compassion come to me so that I may live,
For Your Law is my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the arrogant be put to shame, because they lead me astray with a lie;
But I shall meditate on Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who fear You turn to me,
And those who know Your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my heart be blameless in Your statutes,
So that I will not be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul languishes for Your salvation;
I wait for Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes fail with longing for Your word,
While I say, “When will You comfort me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
I do not forget Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How many are the days of Your servant?
When will You execute judgment on those who persecute me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogant have dug pits for me,
People who are not in accord with Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All Your commandments are faithful;
They have persecuted me with a lie; help me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They almost destroyed me on earth,
But as for me, I did not abandon Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Revive me according to Your faithfulness,
So that I may keep the testimony of Your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forever, Lord,
Your word stands in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your faithfulness continues throughout generations;
You established the earth, and it stands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They stand this day by Your ordinances,
For all things are Your servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If Your Law had not been my delight,
Then I would have perished in my misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will never forget Your precepts,
For by them You have revived me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am Yours, save me;
For I have sought Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked wait for me to destroy me;
I will diligently consider Your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen a limit to all perfection;
Your commandment is exceedingly broad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How I love Your Law!
It is my meditation all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
For they are ever mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have more insight than all my teachers,
For Your testimonies are my meditation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I understand more than those who are old,
Because I have complied with Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
So that I may keep Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not turned aside from Your judgments,
For You Yourself have taught me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How sweet are Your words to my taste!
Yes, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From Your precepts I get understanding;
Therefore I hate every false way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have sworn and I will confirm it,
That I will keep Your righteous judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am exceedingly afflicted;
Revive me, Lord, according to Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be pleased to accept the voluntary offerings of my mouth, Lord,
And teach me Your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My life is continually in my hand,
Yet I do not forget Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked have set a trap for me,
Yet I have not wandered from Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have inherited Your testimonies forever,
For they are the joy of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes
Forever, even to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate those who are double-minded,
But I love Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my hiding place and my shield;
I wait for Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave me, you evildoers,
So that I may comply with the commandments of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sustain me according to Your word, that I may live;
And do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sustain me so that I may be safe,
That I may have regard for Your statutes continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have rejected all those who stray from Your statutes,
For their deceitfulness is useless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have removed all the wicked of the earth like impurities;
Therefore I love Your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh trembles from the fear of You,
And I am afraid of Your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have done justice and righteousness;
Do not leave me to my oppressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be a guarantor for Your servant for good;
Do not let the arrogant oppress me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes fail with longing for Your salvation,
And for Your righteous word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deal with Your servant according to Your graciousness,
And teach me Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am Your servant; give me understanding,
So that I may know Your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is time for the Lord to act,
For they have broken Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I love Your commandments
Above gold, yes, above pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I carefully follow all Your precepts concerning everything,
I hate every false way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your testimonies are wonderful;
Therefore my soul complies with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The unfolding of Your words gives light;
It gives understanding to the simple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I opened my mouth wide and panted,
For I longed for Your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
As is right for those who love Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Establish my footsteps in Your word,
And do not let any wrongdoing have power over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Redeem me from oppression by man,
So that I may keep Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make Your face shine upon Your servant,
And teach me Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes shed streams of water,
Because they do not keep Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are righteous, Lord,
And Your judgments are right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have commanded Your testimonies in righteousness
And great faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My zeal has consumed me,
Because my enemies have forgotten Your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your word is very pure,
Therefore Your servant loves it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am small and despised,
Yet I do not forget Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
And Your Law is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trouble and anguish have come upon me,
Yet Your commandments are my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your testimonies are righteous forever;
Give me understanding that I may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried out with all my heart; answer me, Lord!
I will comply with Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried to You; save me
And I shall keep Your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rise before dawn and cry for help;
I wait for Your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes anticipate the night watches,
So that I may meditate on Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice according to Your faithfulness;
Revive me, Lord, according to Your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who follow after wickedness approach;
They are far from Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are near, Lord,
And all Your commandments are truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From long ago I have known from Your testimonies
That You have founded them forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look at my affliction and rescue me,
For I have not forgotten Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plead my cause and redeem me;
Revive me according to Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Salvation is far from the wicked,
For they do not seek Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great are Your mercies, Lord;
Revive me according to Your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are my persecutors and my enemies,
Yet I do not turn aside from Your testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I see the treacherous and loathe them,
Because they do not keep Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider how I love Your precepts;
Revive me, Lord, according to Your faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sum of Your word is truth,
And every one of Your righteous judgments is everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rulers persecute me without cause,
But my heart stands in awe of Your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rejoice at Your word,
Like one who finds great plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate and loathe falsehood,
But I love Your Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seven times a day I praise You
Because of Your righteous judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who love Your Law have great peace,
And nothing causes them to stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hope for Your salvation, Lord,
And do Your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul keeps Your testimonies,
And I love them exceedingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I keep Your precepts and Your testimonies,
For all my ways are before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my cry come before You, Lord;
Give me understanding according to Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my pleading come before You;
Save me according to Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my lips pour out praise,
For You teach me Your statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my tongue sing about Your word,
For all Your commandments are righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Your hand be ready to help me,
For I have chosen Your precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I long for Your salvation, Lord,
And Your Law is my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my soul live that it may praise You,
And let Your ordinances help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have wandered about like a lost sheep; search for Your servant,
For I do not forget Your commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried to the Lord in my trouble,
And He answered me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue my soul, Lord, from lying lips,
From a deceitful tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will He give to you, and what more will He do to you,
You deceitful tongue?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sharp arrows of the warrior,
With the burning coals of the broom tree!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to me, for I reside in Meshech,
For I have settled among the tents of Kedar!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Too long has my soul had its dwelling
With those who hate peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am for peace, but when I speak,
They are for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will raise my eyes to the mountains;
From where will my help come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My help comes from the Lord,
Who made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not allow your foot to slip;
He who watches over you will not slumber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, He who watches over Israel
Will neither slumber nor sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is your protector;
The Lord is your shade on your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun will not beat down on you by day,
Nor the moon by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will protect you from all evil;
He will keep your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will guard your going out and your coming in
From this time and forever.
